title: Au Coeur de la Vie = in the Heart of Life
abstract: Contents: 'L'oiseau moqueur'. - 'Chickamauga ou la Riviere de la Mort'. - 'La Riviere du Hibou'. Note: Adapted from three short stories by Ambrose Bierce: The Mocking Bird, Chickamauga, An Occurrence at the Owl Creek Bridge.
description: A dramatization of a short story by Ambrose Bierce set during the American Civil War in which a Confederate citizen stands on the scaffold, about to be hanged, and seems, by a series of miracles, to escape death. See also: The story 'La Riviere de Hibou' is available separately on 16mm in the NLA Collection (#0087311). See also: Interview with Robert Enrico about this work in 'Le Desordre et Apres' (X000659).  Credits: Producers, Henry Deutschmeister, Robert Hossein, Paul de Roubaix ; director, writer, Robert Enrico ; photography, Jean Boffety ; music, Henri Lanoe. Cast: Roger Jacquet, Anne Cornaly, Anker Larsen.
